title: Ring of aggravate monster

| =          |                                                               |   |   |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | - | - |
| Name       | aggravate monster                                             |   |   |
| Appearance | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |   |   |
| Base price | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |   |   |
| Weight     | 3                                                             |   |   |

A **ring of aggravate monster** is a type of [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Generation

Rings of aggravate monster are generated [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") 9⁄10 of the time.

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and jewelry shops can sell rings of aggravate monster.

## Description

While worn, the ring confers the [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster") property. [Eating the ring](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") has a 1⁄3 chance of conferring the property as an intrinsic.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 720c62c3](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/720c62c3401cfbb2504b4db416c055a4a21d916b), wearing the ring also increases level difficulty by 15.

## Strategy

While the ring of aggravate monster is generally considered undesirable and frequently used as [polypile](/wiki/Polypile "Polypile") fodder, it still has a few niche uses: [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") can use it to awaken certain monsters and avoid caitiff penalties to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"), and any character trying to lure monsters (such as fodder for [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") or [wraiths](/wiki/Wraith "Wraith") whose [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") they want) can wear the ring temporarily, even while [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible").

If dealing with an unwanted cursed ring, any source of [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth") can override the worst of the ring's effects until you find a means to remove it.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The ring becomes much more perilous to wear even when identified, due to the likelihood of generating monsters that would be far out of depth otherwise - this can also be used deliberately to raise the odds of high-difficulty monsters generating for the purpose of sacrifice, especially for chaotic characters whose [gods](/wiki/God "God") require higher-difficulty corpses to mollify.

## History

The ring of aggravate monster first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). Before that, the ring also appears in *[Rogue](/wiki/Rogue_\(game\) "Rogue (game)")*, where it makes up 1⁄10 of random rings and causes monsters to attack more aggressively.

## Messages

- Several flies buzz angrily around the sink.

  You dropped a ring of aggravate monster down a [sink](/wiki/Sink "Sink"); this message still prints while [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind").

## Variants

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a ring of aggravate monster can be combined with a [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger") at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create a [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), the [Gladiator](/wiki/Gladiator "Gladiator") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") is a ring of aggravate monster named the [Imperial Token](/index.php?title=Imperial_Token\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Imperial Token (page does not exist)"). It confers [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while carried, grants [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") while worn, and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") for the [leadership](/wiki/Leadership "Leadership") effect, which detects all pets on the level and increases the tameness of those within line of sight.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
